bioghist.p: John Redman Coxe (1773-1864) studied in Europe and at the University of Pennsylvania under Dr. Benjamin Rush. He received his M.D. in 1794 from Penn and was professor of chemistry there from 1809 to 1818 and professor of materia medica from 1818 to 1835. He was an author, bibliophile, and an editor considered the founder of medical journalism.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of medical lecture notes (1824-1825), in the hand of an unknown student, entitled "Notes Taken from a Course of Lectures on the Materia Medica Delivered in the University of Pennsylvania by J.R. Coxe M.D. Professor." The volume has a table of contents at the rear. Lecture topics include bloodletting, Indian physick, expectorants, and numerous plants, minerals, and compounds.
